intro: Sanchezia nobilis var. variegata, commonly known as the variegated arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that display shades of green, white, and yellow. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. Sanchezia nobilis var. variegata is a low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for indoor growing conditions.
